link_desc:
Updated: 02.08.2018

What's new?

"TARGET" string mismatch between "disk-statistics" and "disks" is fixed: "location" XML key for "statistics" is switched to "durable_id" key (and preprocessed inside script) to be compatible with all MSA series (not compatible with MSA 2312) and it was preprocessed to be fine.

Supported models: 2312fc, p2000, 2040, 2050

Language: Not applicable

Features:

  • External LLD script
  • Telnet (you can use SSH instead, but telnet is really quicker)
  • Components health state\ operational status

Supported MSA elements (as CLI command "show" arguments): system, versions, controllers, power-supplies, ports, fans, pools, hosts, disks, disk-statistics, vdisks, vdisk-statistics, volumes, volume-statistics, disk-groups, disk-group-statistics.

Installation:

This script provided "as is". You need to create templates with corresponding elements and triggers prototypes. Script works in 2 modes: get list (1) and get data (2).

1) Default "List" mode show XML block number ({#HP_MSA_BLOCK}) and unique object identifier ({#HP_MSA_TARGET}) to make correctly named item prototype. It allow to assign 2 macros.

2) "Data" mode extract correct XML block by it's XML block number ({#HP_MSA_BLOCK}), achieved from (1). This XML fully ready to XPath preprocessing by Zabbix.

Just run it without parameters to get help. You can ask me about solutions via telegram channel "Zabbix Talks" (Anth0ny). I'm too lazy to write the extended information here... Sorry.
author: Anth0nyME
